intro: Echidnopsis quadrangula, commonly known as the quadrangular stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that are arranged in a quadrangular pattern, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. Echidnopsis quadrangula is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
